decision_conditions: Existing roof level extensions at the property have added approximately 56.7 cubic metres of additional volume to the original roofspace. The proposed dormer would add a further 9.135 cubic metres of volume exceeding the cubic content of the original roof space by approximately 65.8 cubic metres. The proposals therefore conflict with B.1(d)(ii) of Class B of Schedule 2, Part 1 of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)(England) Order 2015 (as amended).

It has not been demonstrated that the materials used in any exterior work would be of a similar appearance to those used in the construction of the exterior of the existing dwellinghouse in conflict with Condition B.2(a) of Class B of Schedule 2, Part 1 of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)(England) Order 2015 (as amended).
description: Addition of a dormer window measuring 9.135 cubic metres to the existing east elevation of a dwelling house.
